definition: to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to call a conference/to convene a meeting

sentences.english: We have held these meetings at an important time.
sentences.chinese: 我们在一个重要时刻召开这次会议。

sentences.english: The pro-slavery legislature passed a bill calling for such a convention.
sentences.chinese: 支持奴隶制的立法会通过了要求召开制宪会议的法案。

sentences.english: Methods A part of 2002-2003 7-year medical students and tutors were interviewed.
sentences.chinese: 方法召开七年制学生和导师座谈会。

sentences.english: He has refused to take part in TV debates or give press conferences.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝参加电视辩论，也不召开新闻发布会。

sentences.english: The portents are bad for next month's climate change summit in Copenhagen.
sentences.chinese: 这对于下月在哥本哈根召开的气候变化峰会是种恶兆。

sentences.english: The highest decision-making body of YBAM calls for a National Convention biennially .
sentences.chinese: 马佛青最高决策机构为每两年召开的全国代表大会。

sentences.english: Just as rewarding as the play was the science forum held afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 像演出一样令人受益的是后来召开的科学论坛。

sentences.english: Monday morning Jack presides over the meeting of management.
sentences.chinese: 星期一早上，杰克主持召开了中层干部会议。

sentences.english: Sai Sheng Murng, deputy spokesman of the Shan State Army-South, supported the call for a Panglong-type conference.
sentences.chinese: 南掸邦军副发言人宰盛蒙，支持召开彬龙型协商会议。

sentences.english: In the early time of product design, we will wholly convene a checkup meeting for it .
sentences.chinese: 在产品设计初期，我们会专门召开设计审查会议。

sentences.english: European Inter-bank lending rates fell after the ECB's press conference.
sentences.chinese: 央行新闻发布会召开之后欧洲银行间拆借利率下跌。

sentences.english: The seventh day also shall be most solemn and holy unto you: you shall do no servile work therein.
sentences.chinese: 到第七日再召开圣会，一切劳工都不许做。

sentences.english: State Council held a picturephone meeting on developing recycling economy.
sentences.chinese: 昨天下午，国务院召开发展循环经济电视电话会议。

sentences.english: Great all- China meetings of Party and Red Army delegates were called in May and June.
sentences.chinese: 党和红军的全国代表大会五月和六月间分别召开了。

sentences.english: The senate had a session today with closed doors.
sentences.chinese: 参议院今天召开一次秘密会议。

sentences.english: After the congress, the secretariat moved from Shanghai to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 代表大会召开之后，书记处由上海迁到了北京。

definition: to call a conference/to convene a meeting
general congress/meeting of the whole committee
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
consultative conference (political venue during early communist rule)/consultative meeting/deliberative assembly
